summary: The Helping Emergency Responders Overcome Act (HERO Act) aims to improve mental health support for public safety officers. It mandates the creation of a national data system to track suicide incidence among these officers, funds peer-support programs within fire and emergency medical services agencies, and expands those programs to healthcare providers. The bill also directs the development of educational resources for mental health professionals and establishes best practices for addressing posttraumatic stress disorder in public safety officers.
